column4: admin: I didn't get your message - think you have a prob  ;-)
I didn't get that one either?  Must be a Windows problem?  ;-)
: i need to update my lenovoB570e BIOS is this save form my PC ?
BIOS updates usually have a backup and checksum before being commited into the active ROM.
SATA to CF or SD adapter?
: i put an ISO on that SD card, and now i want to boot from it
I have not tried an SD card but I have an ATA to CF adapter and that works fine - I would assume SD can be addressed in the same way with a ATA or SATA to SD adapter?

Just google SATA to SD adapter. There are loads of them for quite cheap costs. The SD card wil appear as a standard SATA drive in your BIOS. However, be aware SD has limited writes so for data use a traditional drive or a solid state designed for this purpose. The SD should be fine for an OS boot partition.
I have sent you a link to an adapter for sale on a large commercial website!
: thank its word in virtual box - SD to USB -

You want to boot a virtual machine in Virtual Box using an OS based on an SD card plugged into your USB???  I have no idea if that would work, I assume its something that must be supported in the Virtual Box hypervisor?
: i was testing the SD to USB kit on the VMware and it work for me, i assume it will work for real :)
Yes for real it will be quite slick.  I built a workstation with no moving parts once using a similar method.
: that is what i am trying to do "a workstation with no moving parts"
Let us know how you get on with your design - write a blog post.
